resources.string: ONE OF A KIND SHOW AND SALE

The ACC is a multi-purpose indoor sporting arena located on Bay Street in the South Core district of Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Home of the Toronto Maple Leafs, and the Toronto Raptors. Profile of the building, events and schedules, services and facilities details, and rental information.

July 16 – 17, 2016. Come join us in celebrating the 44th Annual Festival of India in the heart of downtown Toronto. The festival consists of an upbeat, colourful parade down Yonge Street (beginning at Bloor and continuing south to Lake Ontario) and two days of …

July 16 – 17, 2016. The Fusion of Taste Festival is a two-day celebration of multiculturalism. The festival is a showcase of ethnic dancing, performing arts, an art show and over 60 vendors with diverse cultural wares.

Art Toronto, Canada’s international modern and contemporary art fair, returns this fall from October 28 – 31 at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre in the city’s downtown core. Now in its 16th year, Art Toronto will exhibit important artwork from an impressive lineup of national and international …
July 8 – 24, 2016. The Beaches International Jazz Festival features more than 100 bands. Admission is FREE for 3 weeks of entertainment in The Beach.

October 19 – 23rd, 2016. Come celebrate their 17th anniversary with the imagineNATIVE Film and Media Arts Festival. This international festival celebrates the latest works by indigenous peoples on the forefront of innovation in film, video, radio and new media.

August 5 – 7, 2016. Krinos Taste of the Danforth is one of Toronto’s signature events, showcasing the best of Mediterranean food, culture, and music our multicultural city has to offer – from souvlaki to gyros, from authentic Greek music to interactive photo ops! Come …

June 4 – August 27, 2015. Enjoy free concerts and the occasional dance tutorial every Thursday night from 7–9 P.M. in beautiful St. James Park at King and Jarvis in downtown Toronto. On the last Thursday of each month, the music is replaced by a …

The 10th edition of Toronto’s annual all-night celebration of contemporary art returns on Saturday, October 3, 2015. For one sleepless night, from sunset to sunrise, Toronto is transformed by more than 130 art projects created by local, national and international artists. Produced by the City …

The 41st One of a Kind Christmas Show is November 24 - December 4, 2016 at the Enercare Centre. Featuring works by hundreds of unique artists, designers and craftspeople, the One of a Kind Show and Sale focuses on homegrown talent, creating an interactive personal shopping experience. …

October 1 – 2, 2016. A weekend-long festival of creativity and community taking place in mid–September, Queen West Art Crawl celebrates and cultivates the unique character, diversity and ethos of Queen West—a natural habitat for individual artists, arts organizations, artist-run centers and businesses that promote art and …

July 23 – 31, 2016. Rogers Cup presented by National Bank is a prestigious professional tennis tournament organized by Tennis Canada. Since 1881 for the men and 1892 for the women, the best players in the world have showcased their skills on Canadian courts. Only Wimbledon …

August 13 – 14, 2016. Roundhouse Craft Beer Festival: Taking over Roundhouse Park, home to Steam Whistle Brewing, the Roundhouse Craft Beer Festival was named one of the top five beer festivals to attend in Toronto by Toronto Life Magazine and possibly one of the …

November 4 – 13, 2016. The largest of its kind in the world, The Royal Agricultural Winter Fair includes: family entertainment in the PC Animal Theatre featuring Spirit of the Horse; rabbit jumping; sheep herding; goats and more; top chef competitions; unique shopping; and over …

October 16, 2016. Join 25,000 runners from around the world in Canada’s #1 Big-City Marathon! Featuring a flat and festive course along Lake Ontario from downtown Toronto, the race is perfect for first timers and Boston qualifiers alike.
November 10 – 12, 2016. The Gentlemen’s Expo is an annual event that aims to entertain and educate men and women in everything surrounding the art and commerce of modern manliness.

July 2 - August 20, 2016. Sponsored by the Toronto Star, the 19th Annual Great Ontario Salmon Derby is North America’s largest freshwater fishing derby and takes place in the Canadian waters of Lake Ontario attracting participants from Florida, Arizona, Michigan and other US States. They also …

September 25, 2016: 11am to 6pm. The Word On The Street is a free festival that celebrates the written word and champions literacy through an annual outdoor book and magazine fair. Showcasing Canada’s hottest new books and authors of the year, as well as the …

Toronto Beer Week (TBW) is a collective series of events dedicated to the celebration and advancement of the craft beer movement. TBW showcases authentically brewed and flavourful beer, the talented brewers who create them, and the licensees who proudly support them. If you want great …

September 8 – 18, 2016. The Toronto International Film Festival is the world’s largest public film festival, screening more than 300 films from around the world in venues across the city. Visit our new home at TIFF Bell Lightbox to get into the Festival …

Toronto Summer Music 2016 celebrates the musical traditions of Great Britain. Don’t miss Toronto’s summer classical music event! This year’s Festival’s theme is London Calling! Music in Great Britain and takes place from July 14 – August 7, 2016.

July 22 – 24, 2016. Toronto’s Festival of Beer is a celebration of Canada’s rich brewing history, hosted by experts of the brewing craft from around the world. Featuring 300+ brands onsite, this is Canada’s premier celebration of the golden beverage! This is a 19+ …

September 15 – 19, 2016. Multi-stage alternative roots music festival in the heart of downtown Toronto at Historic Fort York Garrison Common. Featuring 44 artists, local food vendors, and a kids area.
